page.title: 17Housing in Longdon
page.content: There are some{88 houses}in the area; 33 being built post-war by the{Council and some of these are now {privately {owned.} There is a developement of 10 private houses. The {remaining prop- {erties}in the area are{farm-houses} or {individually designed}homes. Some are obviously modernised and extended {cottages. At least 14 houses are of {timber {construction}and some of the renovated cottages could well have interior oak beams. There are three post-war bungalows near farms which were most probably built for the old folks when the next generation took over the farm-house. The grandest house is {Birtsmorton {Court,} parts of which date back to the{12th Century.} It has a moat, as does {Moat House,}near the Church. There is a{Mobile Homes Park.
